wikipedia_page.main: George Sinclair (1787 – 13 March 1834) was a Scottish gardener.

response: *George Sinclair (mercenary) (1580–1612), Scottish mercenary who saw action in Sweden
*Sir George Sinclair (politician) (1912–2005), British Member of Parliament for Dorking
*Sir George Sinclair, 2nd Baronet (1790–1868), British Member of Parliament for Caithness
*George Sinclair (horticulturist) (1787–1834), gardener to the Duke of Bedford

The Library of Agricultural and Horticultural Knowledge  had a very extensive circulation. It was published in 1830, with a second edition in 1832.T.F. Henderson, ‘Baxter, John (1781–1858)’, Rev. M. Clare Loughlin-Chow, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004 George Sinclair wrote an article On the cultivation of the natural grasses for the publication.Baxter, J. 1830 Library of Agricultural & Horticultural Knowledge, 217 Other authors included John Ellman.
